meanings.definition: To lose consciousness for a short time due to a lack of oxygen to the brain.
meanings.sent1: She fainted during the hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: He fainted after holding his breath for too long.
meanings.sent3: The clown fainted on stage, causing a moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: Her heart fainted with joy when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The old man fainted at the sight of his long-lost friend.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she fainted at the sight of a spider.
meanings.sent2: He fainted when he heard the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The cat fainted dramatically after being startled by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: His hope almost fainted, but he held on to faith.
meanings.sent5: The candlelight fainted slowly as the night grew darker.
